intro: Ursinia scariosa subsp. scariosa, commonly known as the narrow-leaved ursinia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family and is characterized by its slender, often hairy stems and small, yellowish flowers. The plant typically grows in dry, rocky habitats and is adapted to arid conditions. Its leaves are narrow and often covered in a layer of fine, white hairs, which help reduce water loss. It is a perennial herb that produces small, daisy-like blooms, making it a distinctive and resilient species in its native environment.
